newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks swing higher at close,turnover dismal.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks swing higher at close,turnover dismal.

text.p: Tokyo stocks managed to claw back into positive territory by the end of the Monday session but turnover tumbled to a new low for the year, brokers said, adding that it reflected the cautious trade. They said most investors were inactive ahead of the elections on October 20.
The benchmark Nikkei 225 swung back 61.09 points or 0.29 percent higher at 21,029.25. Its December futures were also higher by 90 points, closing at 21,130.
"There was some bargain-hunting, but no aggressive buying," Akihiko Naemura, general manager at Okasan Securities, said. "The market is waiting for the elections to end before moving."
